Elita/Hydras:

Elita paled and slight shaken qhen Sourge was around and she=
 asked in low voice to  Nightshift =E2=80=9Cdo you think that scourge eats =
little kittens?=E2=80=9D 


*****************************

hYDRAS hissed an=
oyed and said =E2=80=9CWhat a waste of power, this saberback could have don=
e a better use of his skills=E2=80=9D


From: Sandy Panico 
Sent: Thursday,=
 August 11, 2011 12:34 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Strange =
meetings - the Silver Dragon and the Preds




With deep breaths, Tucson co=
ols down as nostrils flair to allow faster cooling of his systems.  At the =
same time he raises his neck for another look around.  Then his head is swu=
ng ahead facing northward once again.  His long tail snaps at the ground be=
neath him, taking out what remains of the dinosaur bones, smashing them to =
splinters.  It felt good to roar, it helped to release trapped emotions tha=
t had built up over time.  Certainly Rodimus was trying his patience and it=
 was a good method of not lashing out at him which would have been a grave =
mistake.  He continues to wait for the Fuzors to arrive.  He thinks to hims=
elf as he does.

" Till all are one.   I most certainly hope you're right a=
bout this,Primus.  Our lives depend on your theory."

Meanwhile, having bee=
n above in Waspinator's grasp, Straight Shot could actually sense some good=
 attributes in him if there were any to be sensed.  Although they could nev=
er be allies she still could sense something positive about him.  His sense=
 of sticking to things even if he didn't like doing them, was admirable and=
 she felt he should be complemented.

" Waspinator, look I know you hate me=
 with a passion and you aren't exactly on my friends list but I want you to=
 know that I really admire your loyalty toward this mission and having the =
tolerance to work with an enemy bot.  You're doing a really good job, keep =
it up."

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Aug 11, 2011, at=
 12:25 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:


    
  > <OLD>=

  >
  > Tucson looks to Hydras with a stern expression. He then back at Ro=
dimus.
  >
  > "So you chose to continue. Good, this time try to refrain fr=
om making snide
  > comments. AND HYDRAS, IF YOU SO MUCH AS TURN ON ANY OF =
US THIS ALLIANCE IS
  > OVER! AM I UNDERSTOOD!?"
  >
  > He gives him a ser=
ious glare.

  <NEW>

  For a moment RODIMUS just stopped as TUSCON spoke a=
nd then turned and
  looked at him, his face a soldier's face. "We will tal=
k later." And
  then he turned back to continue on his path, shifting into =
his
  vehicular mode as he moved.

  Above him CYCLONUS floated, a large je=
t, his wings positioned for
  atmospheric flight. "If it means anything you=
 were not given a
  warrior's chance in battle." CYCLONUS said quietly to R=
ODIMUS, "That
  was wrong. If we fight, it will not be from a stab in the b=
ack or a
  reprogramming, it will be machine to machine weapon to weapon."
=

  There was a grunt from RODIMUS, "You know Cyclonus, I almost look
  fowa=
rd to that."

  The two drove on, trying to find a way for mortal enemies t=
o work together.
  > <OLD <Tuscon>
  >
  > STAND BY ALL SOLDIERS! DEPLOYING=
 SONAR ATTACK AT FULL STRENGTH!"
  >
  > With a deep breath, Tucson rattles=
 the horizon with a sensor splitting sonic
  > inhibited roar. A wave of so=
nar energy is cast from his throat and powerful
  > vocalizers. Sharp teeth=
 and fangs glimmer in the moonlight as a strong
  > silver tail thrashes th=
e ground beneath his four feet.

  As TUSCON's warning is heard the Predaco=
ns shift their audio circuits
  off as they glance back at at the large dra=
gon.

  >>>RRROOOAAARRR!!!<<<

  TUSCON's roar can be heard for hundreds of=
 miles as the sound of it
  echoes and re-echoes out across the miles and m=
iles of dead dinosaurs.
  One of the first things he reailzes is that altho=
ugh capable of large
  amounts of damage, It is rougher and cruder in its s=
ensory mode, but
  capable of far more damage then he could once deliver be=
fore.

  It is almost like a wind has picked up and blown some of the bodie=
s
  back. Dinosaurs that are caught in the cone of effect are broken and
  =
tossed about, bones vibrating and then snapped as if hit by a tidal
  wave,=
 although instead of one of water, this one is made of sound.

  No, it was=
 not the same as his original sonar, but it was very effective indeed!

  A=
round TUSCON the Predacons, as well as probrably the Maximals leaped
  out =
of the way as the cones sweeps through. At high enough levels
  sound can d=
o actual physical damage and not just bust ear drums and
  over load audio =
circuits.

  As the roar dies down, the damage that is done is incredible a=
nd
  TUSCON's energy cells are slowly trying to recharge themselves from
  =
such a high energy output (OOC: He has to catch his breath). Across
  the s=
ensors there is no evidence of anyone being affected beyond the
  dead dino=
saurs and the movement of TUSCON's allies.

  As far as anyone could tell e=
ither their enemy was out of range of
  TUSCON's roar or was protected by t=
hem in some manner.

  "That was interesting." SKY SHADOW said from his pos=
ition next to
  HYDRAS as he shrugged his shoulders.

  "And loud!" INJECTO=
R said as he buzzed near by. He was in beast mode
  looking like a strange =
cross of lionfish and hornet.

  CYCLONUS and RODIMUS continued up towards =
the path of devastation left
  by the dinosaurs, RODIMUS weaving between th=
e bodies in vehicle mode
  while CYCLONUS just flew above them as a jet.

 =
 (TAG)

  Preston
